results.title: Washtenaw playground
results.creator_credit: Paul Hogan, Ralph Lopatin, Mario Fratini and Joan Bressler
results.brief_description: The playground for the Washtenaw Intermediate Unit of Ann Arbor, Michigan is the most recent and most successful playground built with the assistance of the Playground Clearing House. With careful advance planning, the entire playground was built in three days. It involved the use of over a half million dollars worth of construction equipment. Narrated by Sherry Steiner.

results.title: Washington: the first seven years
results.creator_credit: Turners Film Productions and David Cox
results.brief_description: A new town in a coal mining area, Washington in the United Kingdom was the twenty-first new town to be built in post-war Britain. The third to be built in N.E. England. Reflects on the days of the coal mining towns and the low standard of living. Washington represents a new world of living in modern England surrounded by new motorways - industrial areas separated from residential areas - social and industrial development. Washington is made up of several villages with a proposed town centre to unite the villages. Directed and photographed by David Cox.

results.title: Washington square
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Picture, Caravan Pictures, Alchemy Filmworks, Roger Birnbaum, Julie Bergman Sender and Agnieszka Holland
results.brief_description: Jennifer Jason Leigh stars as Catherine Sloper, a ‘plain’ and socially inept young woman with a domineering father who blames his daughter for the death of his wife during childbirth. Incapable of expressing any love or tenderness towards his daughter, Dr. Sloper (Albert Finney) is immediately suspicious of the handsome young suitor who starts pursuing her. Believing that Morris Townsend’s (Ben Chaplin) interest in Catherine is motivated by her wealth, Dr. Sloper does everything in his power to forbid the liaison. Willing to surrender her inheritance in order to marry Morris, Catherine gradually realises that nobody wants her to make this sacrifice. Also stars Maggie Smith and Judith Ivey. Based upon the novel by Henry James which was filmed as ‘The Heiress’ by William Wyler. Screenplay by Carol Doyle. Photographed by Jerzy Zielinski. Edited by David Siegel. Music by Jan P. Kaczmarek.

results.title: Washington D.C.: a living city
results.creator_credit: Herbert H. Rosen, Edmund Frost and Frost Productions
results.brief_description: Washington D.C. is a city of contrasts - past and present, church and cabaret, airports and railways, parks for baseball and riding bicycles and hikers.The city is cultural aswell, the National Gallery of Art is visited, the Netherlands Carrillion heard and the National Symphony plays in a park on a summers day. Script by Herbert R. Rosen, photographed by Foster Wiley, edited by David Powell, music by Berie and Fred Cherney, commentary by Barton Heyman. Produced for the Washington Area Convention and Visitor’s Bureau.

results.brief_description: An amusing study of various animals in the London Zoo enjoying a bath or a swim: polar bears, elephant, hippo, birds and others.

results.title: Washing machine circa 1522
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn animation on paper in sepia tone in response to the theme washing machine and metamorphosis. Martin Luther (1483-1546) is a monk but also religious reformer and inventor. As he is working hard on an invention when he is attacked by a ‘Japanese’ insect. The affected monk slips into various states of metamorphosis whilst wrestling with inventing the washing machine. A tool of the Devil.

results.title: Washing machine [the cat]
results.brief_description: This humourous hand-drawn animation is in response to the theme washing machine. A meowing cat (Howard Tal van Kleef) is locked in the laundry as a disciplinary measure by its owner. The cat’s curiosity for the outside gets the better of him when a dog frightens him into a free-fall from the window ledge towards the operating washing machine. The cat has a near death experience, his important memories flash by as he falls.

results.title: Washing machine [caveman]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. A caveman’s chase of a dinosaur is interrupted by his curiosity for a mysterious object in the landscape, a washing machine. He fiddles with and bashes the washing machine in an attempt to work out what it is and discovers its’ function, a ‘drinking fountain’ (pre-historic term unknown).

results.title: Washing feel good movie
results.brief_description: This film depicts cleanliness as a good idea by developing understanding of its benefits; particularly health reasons for personal and environmental cleanliness. Portrays children experiencing the pleasures of getting dirty and the pleasure of being clean.

results.title: Wash and brush up
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A complete description of the processes undergone by a steam locomotive when it is sent to the sheds for cleaning and a detailed mechanical check-up.
